docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court’s ruling on the Defense of Marriage Act gives gay couples more rights, but also means that some will have to pay higher taxes.

headline.main: Victory, and Tax Changes, for Same-Sex Couples
headline.print_headline: Victory, and Tax Changes, for Same-Sex Couples

docs.abstract: Supreme Court’s ruling on the Defense of Marriage Act gives gay couples more rights, but also means that some will have to pay higher taxes; they face dealing with matrix of state and local tax laws.

docs.lead_paragraph: Unless and until Congress renews all sorts of deductions, tax specialists warn, it will be hard for small businesses to plan for expansion.

headline.main: For Small Businesses, a Road Without a Map
headline.print_headline: For Small Businesses, a Road Without a Map

docs.abstract: Tax specialists warn that unless and until Congress renews all sorts of expired deductions, small business owners face challenges in trying to expand.
docs.snippet: Unless and until Congress renews all sorts of deductions, tax specialists warn, it will be hard for small businesses to plan for expansion.

docs.lead_paragraph: The goal of bystander intervention programs is to block bad behavior before it crosses the line from drunken partying to rape.

headline.main: Stepping Up to Stop Sexual Assault
headline.print_headline: Stepping Up to Stop Sexual Assault

docs.abstract: Some colleges are offering bystander intervention programs as way of preventing rape on campus; goal of programs is to encourage observers to step in and stop bad behavior before it crosses line from drunken partying to assault.
docs.snippet: The goal of bystander intervention programs is to block bad behavior before it crosses the line from drunken partying to rape.

docs.lead_paragraph: She always vehemently insisted that I didn’t need to get married, didn’t need a man.

headline.main: Did Mother, Maybe, Not Know Best?
headline.print_headline: Did Mother, Maybe, Not Know Best?

docs.abstract: Heidi Basarab Modern Love column describes her decision to marry her long-term boyfriend despite the fact that her mother had repeatedly and vehemently told her as a child that she did not need to get married or have anyone take care of her.
docs.snippet: She always vehemently insisted that I didn’t need to get married, didn’t need a man.

docs.lead_paragraph: A lawsuit challenging Arizona Gov. Jan Brewer's Medicaid expansion plan that was filed by fellow Republicans in the state Legislature was dismissed in a ruling released Saturday, handing Brewer a major victory in her battle against conservative members of her own party.

docs.lead_paragraph: In an assertion of same-sex marriage rights, Attorney General Eric Holder is applying a landmark Supreme Court ruling to the Justice Department, announcing Saturday that same-sex spouses cannot be compelled to testify against each other, should be eligible to file for bankruptcy jointly and are entitled to the same rights and privileges as federal prison inmates in opposite-sex marriages.

headline.main: Holder Applies Same-Sex Marriage Ruling to Justice

docs.lead_paragraph: The 14 states running their own health insurance marketplaces had all their startup costs footed by the federal government, but they're supposed to pay for themselves starting next year under the federal health care reform law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of people with HIV/AIDS in Louisiana trying to obtain coverage under President Barack Obama's healthcare reform are in danger of being thrown out of the insurance plan they selected in a dispute over federal subsidies and the interpretation of federal rules about preventing Obamacare fraud.
